metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8310 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap out-of-bound read in CreateHtmlSubtitle in VideoLAN VLC 2.2.x due tomissing check of string termination allows attackers to read data beyondallocated memory and potentially crash the process (causing a denial ofservice) via a crafted subtitles file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8310` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
libvlccore8 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-data - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-nox - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-samba - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.3').
